intro: Ornithogalum corticatum, commonly known as the bark lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulbous stem. The plant produces erect, leafy stems that bear clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Ornithogalum corticatum is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
